reviewText: As a long-time listener to A Prairie Home Companion, I really enjoyed this glimpse into the show as only video can do.  I love the stories and the music!  Together with the Hollwood movie by the same name, you have a most enjoyable entertainment experience and feel even closer to the folks who have entertained America for decades with good, clean humor and music.  I long ago turned off my radio due to the lack of decent music and entertainment - with this one exception!  If you like the radio version, you will love the video and will watch it over and over.
summary: A great look into Prairie Home Companion!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Forget Altamount, MOnterrey, Hendrix at Berkley, even Woodstock! THIS is the worst filmed live concert EVER! Even if they claim they were trying to copy those historic live filmings (where drunk and high cameramen dropped cameras or went wild with the new zoom lenses or found the WRONG performer) there is no excuse for the lousy filming of this live and heavily scripted concert with NO movement. WHO DID THE EDITTING HERE? and what stock did they work from?Turn off the video and go audio only and you have a real decent Keillor show, even if they pull their punches for the camera and history. For example: Where's the real cool BUsh jokes?And lose the white lady singing and just go with the Black woman with the voice of God. aND  tell your cameraman how to find that great lap steel player who is NEVER pictured!
summary: WORST concert video, but HEY, it's a RADIO show, ok?

reviewText: This disc is for all women who are strong, all men who are good looking, all children who are above average, and everyone else too. Whether you've been listening since 1974 or the 1980s or since the show has been archived online since 1996, this DVD is for you. For those who are new to it, this is a radio show from Minnesota that airs at 5pm Minnesota time (6pm my time) on NPR Saturdays which is full of light music (country, gospel, bluegrass, etc.), drama, humor and more.  Hosted by Garrison Keillor along with Sue Scott, Tim Russell, the sound effects man of the night Tom Keith or Fred Newman (the latter usually for shows on the road not at their home base in St Paul, Minnesota but both appear on this disc), and a who's who of guests.  Except for on the Disney Channel briefly in the early 90s, unless you went to the Fitzgerald Theater or to one of their on tour locales  live, you had to just use your imagination while listening to your radio.  Now for the first time we can watch a show as it unfolds right in our own homes anytime we want.  This show aired (well the main thrust of it) on NPR on May 15, 2004 (their last show at their home base for the 2003-2004 season) to celebrate the show's 30th Anniversary (first broadcast for you history buffs was July 6, 1974), and it gives a good view what the show offers on a weekly basis.  If you wanna sample others, visit [...] and go into the show archives where you can playback on your real player any show that aired since January of 1996 in whole or in part.  The archives also include 2 shows from 1985 which were rerun during the 90s as a tribute to the memory of Chet Atkins who guest starred on both and was regarded by show host Garrison Keillor as a special friend.  Buy this disc, visit the archives, then put your radio on Saturday nights.  Whether it's a live show, rerun, or this disc you will be in stitches for the next 2 hours, and wish it would never end, or that you were there live.:-).

reviewText: Watching along with five other Old Geezers we could not Stop our LaffinK! It WAS A TOSS-UP TO Whedder THE SHOW STOPPER vas THE  DUO OF mstreep & lily Tom singing "Softly and Tenderly" or the  Country stuff with Woody ad His cotton-pickin Mate singing, Go Tell Aunt Roddie or Frankie & Johnny?We both dozed off 'cause we was comfortable & at ease with our memories! It was filled with down home humor and witty sarcasm, as only GK can deliver in writing or casting on his weeking radio things!If I only can get 3 for $40 I Wlll buy a 100! Next  Time  maybe  we get to see it for the sounds & Songs! Retired Chap Fred W Hood, Barbara 377
summary: Hearing & seeing  the GK Persona On Screen is WOW

reviewText: Out here in Portland, we get "Prairie Home Companion" broadcasts on both Saturday evenings and Sunday afternoons, and nothing makes for a perfect afternoon drive than Garrison Keillor and his team's weekly variety show.  A combination of home-spun wisdom, subtle wit (spiced with just a hint of sex), and glorious down-home music make for two of the most enjoyable hours of the week.  I'm not sure what the official standards are for these things, but for fans nationwide, "PHC" is a national treasure.This DVD captures the 30th anniversary broadcast of this immortal show, live from the Fitzgerald Theatre in St. Paul, Minnesota.  GK refers to the show as the 30th anniversary broadcast a couple of times, but other than that there is little to distinguish this show from the hundreds of other shows.  The usual cast does their usual skits, including Lefty and Dusty as the two cowboys, the ad from the Catsup Advisory Board, a Guy Noir riff, and ads on how to become a trained sound effects master in just 38 weeks.For music, the Guy's All Star Shoe Band is in rare form, including a few special guests.  This is the kind of American music that makes you sit back and smile - watch for some masterful mandolin, steel guitar, and piano work.  Also, a rockabilly band from Nashville, BR489, stomps through a few honky-tonk tracks.And then there's the news from Lake Woebegon, as told by GK.  This episode revolves around the adage, "It could have been different."  Lake Woebegon's stories always have some Minnesota folk wisdom to impart, along with the jokes, and "It could have been different" is a perfect choice for an anniversary broadcast.  What would it be like if GK had instead gone into writing movies, or become a dentist, or been the world's wisest filbert farmer?  Here, GK acknowledges his good fortune but is also quick to shrug off the accolades that always come your way on an anniversary or milestone - it indeed could have been different.If you are a fan of "PHC" or know someone who is, this is a perfect gift.
summary: Perfect gift for any "Prairie Home Companion" fan
